hero.subline: Competitive Programmer passionate about algorithms, data structures, and problem solving. Active on LeetCode, Codeforces, and VJudge with a strong ICPC record.

coach.name: Norhan Ihab Abdulrahman Elsayed
coach.role: Competitive Programmer | Problem Solving Mentor | Software Engineer
coach.university: B.Eng. in Computer & Control Systems Engineering, Mansoura University (2020–2025) — Accumulated Grade: 95.73%
snapshot: ACPC 2025 Finalist, 3× ECPC Finalist, and Bronze Medalist in ACPC Girls 2023 & 2024.
Active problem solver on LeetCode, Codeforces (MiraculousN), and VJudge.
Regular mentor at IEEE Student Chapter and ICPC Mansoura Community.
Strong command of computational geometry, dynamic programming, graph algorithms, and mathematical optimization.
Practices problem solving daily and helps others improve their algorithmic thinking.
achievements: Top 7% worldwide in International Youth Mathematical Championship (IYMC 2019).
Mentored students in ICPC Mansoura and IEEE Student Chapter training camps.
projects: Competitive Problem Archive — organized +500 solved problems categorized by topic.
Algorithm Visualizer — mini C++ console project for pathfinding and recursion demos.
Smart Home Simulation — embedded project with automation sensors.
Smart Wallet — embedded and logic-based hardware prototype.

items.q: What is Norhan most passionate about?
items.a: Problem solving and algorithms — she enjoys tackling new challenges daily on platforms like LeetCode and Codeforces.

items.q: Which contests has she competed in?
items.a: ACPC (Finalist 2025), ECPC (3× Finalist), ACPC Girls (Bronze Medalist), IYMC, MYMC, and IEEEXtreme.

items.q: How does she contribute to the community?
items.a: She mentors students in ICPC Mansoura Community and IEEE, conducts upsolving sessions, and posts problem-solving videos on YouTube.
To continue mastering algorithms, contribute to open-source PS resources, and help new programmers strengthen their logical problem-solving skills.

footer.blurb: Empowering coders through problem-solving excellence and ICPC-style mentorship.
